unnormalised: **Automotive Sector Sees Flurry of Vehicle Launches, Driving Innovation**
normalised: Automotive Sector Sees Flurry of Vehicle Launches, Driving Innovation

unnormalised: The Indian automotive market is witnessing a surge in new vehicle launches, reflecting both evolving consumer preferences and technological advancements. Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam Automotive Research Institute highlighted that Q3 2024 saw a 25% increase in launches compared to the same period last year.
normalised: The Indian automotive market is witnessing a surge in new vehicle launches, reflecting both evolving consumer preferences and technological advancements. Doctor A P J Abdul Kalam Automotive Research Institute highlighted that Q three two thousand and twenty four saw a twenty five percent increase in launches compared to the same period last year.

unnormalised: Tata Motors unveiled its new electric SUV, the 'Nexon EV Shakti,' boasting a 450 km range and advanced safety features. Maruti Suzuki followed suit with the 'Alto 800 CNG Plus,' targeting budget-conscious buyers in Tier-II cities.
normalised: Tata Motors unveiled its new electric S U V, the 'Nexon E V Shakti,' boasting a four hundred and fifty kilometer range and advanced safety features. Maruti Suzuki followed suit with the 'Alto eight hundred C N G Plus,' targeting budget-conscious buyers in Tier-two cities.

unnormalised: Industry experts note a growing trend towards hybrid and electric vehicles, driven by rising fuel costs and environmental concerns. Mahindra & Mahindra showcased a prototype of its hydrogen-powered truck, signaling a commitment to sustainable mobility.
normalised: Industry experts note a growing trend towards hybrid and electric vehicles, driven by rising fuel costs and environmental concerns. Mahindra and Mahindra showcased a prototype of its hydrogen-powered truck, signaling a commitment to sustainable mobility.

unnormalised: These launches also incorporate advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS) and connected car technology. The average showroom floor space for these new vehicles is around 2000 sq ft, with dealerships offering attractive financing options. Initial prices for these new entries range from Rs. 6 lakhs to Rs. 25 lakhs, depending on the model and features. The competition is expected to further intensify in the coming months, benefiting Indian consumers.
normalised: These launches also incorporate advanced driver-assistance systems (A D A S) and connected car technology. The average showroom floor space for these new vehicles is around two thousand square feet, with dealerships offering attractive financing options. Initial prices for these new entries range from rupees six lakh to rupees twenty five lakh, depending on the model and features. The competition is expected to further intensify in the coming months, benefiting Indian consumers.
